properties.title: Concierge OSGi - An optimized OSGi R3 implementation for mobile and embedded systems - Bundles
properties.author: Jan S. Rellermeyer

meta.name: description
meta.content: Concierge is an optimized OSGi R3 implementation with a minimal file and memory footprint, which makes it ideal for small and embedded devices.

section.name: Bundles
section.p: So far, only few standard service bundles have been implemented for Concierge. So on sufficiently powerful devices, the bundles of Knopflerfish, from the Oscar Bundle Repository, or from the OSGi Bundle Repository can be used on Concierge. However, we will try to implement useful services with the same focus on efficiency that Concierge has.

tr.td: The OSGi service tracker. We have tuned it a bit for better performance.
A minimalistic shell for resource-constrained environments. The shell is extensible at runtime, other bundles can register management extensions.
Our "Yes, it runs with Concierge" splash screen. Not terribly useful but nice for testing and demos.
A small GUI that runs on PDAs and smart phones. Can be used to manage bundles.
R4 EventAdmin backport for Concierge. Can be used with R-OSGi.
